definition: Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)/surname Shang
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially

sentences.english: During Xia, Shang and Zhou dynasties, Central Plains lay the core of Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 夏商周三代文明，中原獨領風騷，居於全國中樞地位。

sentences.english: The thoughts on criminology originated in Xia, Shang and Zhou Periods in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代的犯罪學思想最早可追溯到夏商周三代時期。

sentences.english: The kingdoms of Xia, Shang and Zhou were developed from this background.
sentences.chinese: 夏商周王國正是在此基礎上發展演變的。

sentences.english: The Xia-Shang-Zhou Chronology Project aims at draw up of chronological table scientifically.
sentences.chinese: 夏商周斷代工程的總目標是制訂有科學依據的年表。

definition: Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
three sovereigns 三皇[san1 huang2] and five emperors 五帝[wu3 di4] of myth and legend/the earliest system of Chinese historiography
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
dynasty/reign (of a king)
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
